è´ªåƒè›‡é¢œè‰²RED = (255, 0, 0) # é£Ÿç‰©é¢œè‰²BLACK = (0, 0, 0) # èƒŒæ™¯é¢œè‰²BLUE = (0, 0, 255) # è›‡å¤´é¢œè‰² game.py 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100import pygamefrom snake_and_food import Snake, Foodimport game_configimport timedef init_game(): """åˆå§‹åŒ– Pygameã€çª—å£å’Œæ—¶é’Ÿå’Œå­—ä½“""" pygame.init() screen = pygame.display.set_mode((game_config.WIDTH, game_config.HEIGHT)) pygame.display.set_caption("è´ªåƒè›‡") clock = pygame.time.Clock() # åˆå§‹åŒ–å­—ä½“ pygame.font.init() font = pygame.font.Font(None, 36) # ä½¿ç”¨é»˜è®¤å­—ä½“ï¼Œå¤§å°36 return screen, clock, fontdef handle_events(snake_dir): """å¤„ç†é”®ç›˜äº‹ä»¶""" for event in pygame.event.get(): if event.type == pygame.QUIT: return False, snake_dir elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN: if event.key == pygame.K_UP and snake_dir != (0, 1): snake_dir = (0, -1) elif event.key == pygame.K_DOWN and snake_dir != (0, -1): snake_dir = (0, 1) elif event.key == pygame.K_LEFT and snake_dir != (1, 0): snake_dir = (-1, 0) elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT and snake_dir != (-1, 0): snake_dir = (1, 0) return True, snake_dirdef Ui_OVER(screen, font): for i in range(3):#é—ªçƒä¸‰æ¬¡ screen.fill(game_config.WHITE) # æ¸…å± pygame.display.flip() # åˆ·æ–°å±å¹• time.sleep(0.1) screen.fill(game_config.BLACK) # æ¸…å± pygame.display.flip() # åˆ·æ–°å±å¹• time.sleep(0.1) screen.fill(game_config.BLACK) # æ¸…å± text_surface = font.render("GAME OVER", True, (255, 255, 255)) text_rect = text_surface.get_rect(center=(game_config.WIDTH // 2, game_config.HEIGHT // 2)) # æ¸…å±å¹¶ç»˜åˆ¶æ–‡æœ¬ screen = pygame.display.set_mode((game_config.WIDTH, game_config.HEIGHT)) screen.fill(game_config.BLACK) screen.blit(text_surface, text_rect) # è®©æ–‡æœ¬å±…ä¸­ pygame.display.flip() time.sleep(1) def game_loop(): """ä¸»æ¸¸æˆå¾ªç¯""" screen, clock, font = init_game() snake = Snake() food = Food() running = True snake_dir = (1, 0) # åˆå§‹æ–¹å‘ while running: clock.tick(10) running, snake_dir = handle_events(snake_dir) screen.fill(game_config.BLACK) # æ¸…å± running = snake.move(snake_dir, food) # ç»˜åˆ¶é£Ÿç‰© food_x = food.food[0] * game_config.GRID_SIZE food_y = food.food[1] * game_config.GRID_SIZE food_rect = (food_x, food_y, game_config.GRID_SIZE, game_config.GRID_SIZE) pygame.draw.rect(screen, game_config.RED, food_rect) # ç»˜åˆ¶è›‡èº« for index, segment in enumerate(snake.body): segment_x = segment[0] * game_config.GRID_SIZE segment_y = segment[1] * game_config.GRID_SIZE segment_rect = (segment_x, segment_y, game_config.GRID_SIZE, game_config.GRID_SIZE) # è›‡å¤´é¢œè‰²ä¸ºè“è‰²ï¼Œè›‡èº«é¢œè‰²ä¸ºç»¿è‰² color = game_config.BLUE if index == 0 else game_config.GREEN pygame.draw.rect(screen, color, segment_rect) # ç»˜åˆ¶è›‡èº« # æ¸²æŸ“å¹¶ç»˜åˆ¶æ–‡æœ¬ score = len(snake.body) - 3 text_surface = font.render(f"Game Score: {score}", True, (255, 255, 255)) screen.blit(text_surface, (10, 10)) # ä½ç½® (10, 10) pygame.display.flip() # åˆ·æ–°å±å¹• Ui_OVER(screen, font) pygame.quit()if __name__ == "__main__": game_loop() snake_and_food.py 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960import randomimport game_config# è®¿é—®å˜é‡çš„æ–¹å¼WIDTH = game_config.WIDTHHEIGHT = game_config.HEIGHTGRID_SIZE = game_config.GRID_SIZEGREEN = game_config.GREENRED = game_config.REDBLACK = game_config.BLACKclass Snake: """è´ªåƒè›‡ç±»""" def __init__(self, body=None, direction=None): """åˆå§‹åŒ–è›‡èº«å’Œæ–¹å‘""" self.body = body[:] if body else [(5, 5), (4, 5), (3, 5)] # å¤åˆ¶é»˜è®¤è›‡èº«ï¼Œé˜²æ­¢å…±äº« self.direction = direction if direction else (1, 0) def move(self, direction, food): """è›‡ç§»åŠ¨é€»è¾‘""" new_head = (self.body[0][0] + direction[0], self.body[0][1] + direction[1]) # æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦æ’å¢™ if new_head[0] < 0 or new_head[1] < 0 or new_head[0] >= WIDTH // GRID_SIZE or new_head[1] >= HEIGHT // GRID_SIZE: return False # æ’å¢™ï¼Œæ¸¸æˆç»“æŸ # æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦å’¬åˆ°è‡ªå·± if new_head in self.body: return False # æ›´æ–°è›‡çš„ä½ç½® self.body.insert(0, new_head) if new_head == food.food: food.eaten(self.body) # ç”Ÿæˆæ–°é£Ÿç‰© else: self.body.pop() # ç§»é™¤å°¾éƒ¨ï¼Œä¿æŒé•¿åº¦ return True # ç§»åŠ¨æˆåŠŸclass Food: """é£Ÿç‰©ç±»""" def __init__(self, color=RED): """åˆå§‹åŒ–é£Ÿç‰©ä½ç½®""" self.color = color self.food = self.generate_food([]) # åˆå§‹æ—¶ä¸ä¸è›‡é‡å  def generate_food(self, snake_body): """ç”Ÿæˆæ–°çš„é£Ÿç‰©ä½ç½®ï¼Œç¡®ä¿ä¸ä¸è›‡èº«é‡å """ while True: food = (random.randint(0, (WIDTH // GRID_SIZE) - 1), random.randint(0, (HEIGHT // GRID_SIZE) - 1)) if food not in snake_body: return food def eaten(self, snake_body): """è¢«åƒæ‰åé‡æ–°ç”Ÿæˆ""" self.food = self.generate_food(snake_body)

å¦‚æœæ‰¾åˆ°äº†æ›´å°çš„å€¼ï¼Œåˆ™äº¤æ¢ arr[i], arr[min_index] = arr[min_index], arr[i] return arr# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [64, 25, 12, 22, 11]sorted_arr = selection_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [11, 12, 22, 25, 64] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) )ï¼ˆå·²ç»æ’åºä»ç„¶éœ€è¦æ¯”è¾ƒï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) )ï¼ˆå®Œå…¨é€†åºï¼Œéœ€è¦äº¤æ¢ï¼‰ å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(1) )ï¼ˆåŸåœ°æ’åºï¼Œæ— é¢å¤–ç©ºé—´å¼€é”€ï¼‰ âœ… é€‰æ‹©æ’åºé€‚ç”¨äºå°è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½†å¯¹äºå¤§æ•°æ®ä¸å¤Ÿé«˜æ•ˆ ğŸš€ å†’æ³¡æ’åº å†’æ³¡æ’åºåŸç†ï¼š ä¸¤ä¸¤æ¯”è¾ƒç›¸é‚»å…ƒç´ ï¼Œå¦‚æœé¡ºåºä¸å¯¹ï¼Œåˆ™äº¤æ¢å®ƒä»¬ï¼› ä¸€è½®éå†åï¼Œæœ€å¤§å…ƒç´ ä¼šè¢«â€œå†’æ³¡â€åˆ°æ•°ç»„æœ«å°¾ï¼› é‡å¤æ­¥éª¤ 1 å’Œ 2ï¼Œç›´åˆ°æ•´ä¸ªæ•°ç»„æœ‰åºã€‚ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 12345678910111213141516def bubble_sort(arr): n = len(arr) for i in range(n - 1): # å¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰å‘ç”Ÿäº¤æ¢ï¼Œè¯´æ˜å·²æ’åºå¥½ break return arr# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [64, 25, 12, 22, 11]sorted_arr = bubble_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [11, 12, 22, 25, 64] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n) )ï¼ˆå·²æ’åºï¼Œä¼˜åŒ–ç‰ˆæœ¬åªéœ€ 1 è½®ï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) )ï¼ˆå®Œå…¨é€†åºï¼‰ å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(1) )ï¼ˆåŸåœ°æ’åºï¼Œæ— é¢å¤–ç©ºé—´ï¼‰ âœ… é€‚ç”¨äºå°è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½†å¯¹äºå¤§æ•°æ®æ•ˆç‡ä½ ğŸš€ æ’å…¥æ’åº æ’å…¥æ’åºåŸç†ï¼š å°†æ•°ç»„åˆ†æˆ å·²æ’åº å’Œ æœªæ’åº ä¸¤éƒ¨åˆ†ã€‚ ä¾æ¬¡ä»æœªæ’åºéƒ¨åˆ†å–å‡ºå…ƒç´ ï¼Œæ’å…¥ åˆ°å·²æ’åºéƒ¨åˆ†çš„æ­£ç¡®ä½ç½®ã€‚ ç›´åˆ°æ‰€æœ‰å…ƒç´ éƒ½æ’å…¥å®Œæˆï¼Œæ•°ç»„å˜ä¸ºæœ‰åºã€‚ å¼€å§‹æœ‰åºåŒºåªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªï¼Œæ¯”ä»–å¤§çš„éƒ½å¾€åç§»åŠ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæ ¼å­ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 123456789101112131415def insertion_sort(arr): n = len(arr) for i in range(1, n): # ä»ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªå…ƒç´ å¼€å§‹ï¼ˆç´¢å¼• 1ï¼‰ key = arr[i] # å–å‡ºå½“å‰å¾…æ’å…¥çš„å…ƒç´  j = i - 1 while j >= 0 and arr[j] > key: # å‘å·¦å¯»æ‰¾åˆé€‚ä½ç½® arr[j + 1] = arr[j] # åç§»å…ƒç´  j -= 1 arr[j + 1] = key # æ’å…¥å…ƒç´  return arr# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [64, 25, 12, 22, 11]sorted_arr = insertion_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [11, 12, 22, 25, 64] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n) )ï¼ˆæ•°ç»„å·²æ’åºï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) )ï¼ˆå®Œå…¨é€†åºï¼‰ å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(1) )ï¼ˆåŸåœ°æ’åºï¼‰ âœ… é€‚ç”¨äºå°è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®ï¼Œç¨³å®šæ’åºï¼Œæ€§èƒ½ä¼˜äºå†’æ³¡æ’åº ğŸš€ å¸Œå°”æ’åº ã€æ•°æ®ç»“æ„â€”â€”ä¸€åˆ†é’Ÿæå®šæ’å…¥æ’åºã€‘ https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1Y8411T7LC/?share_source=copy_web&vd_source=59d9734fc97a6b9510465651bf85b98c å¸Œå°”æ’åºåŸç†ï¼š åŸºäºæ’å…¥æ’åº çš„æ”¹è¿›ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œå…ˆå¯¹ è¾ƒå¤§é—´éš” çš„å…ƒç´ è¿›è¡Œæ’åºï¼Œå†é€æ­¥å‡å°é—´éš”ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆè¿›è¡Œæ™®é€šæ’å…¥æ’åºã€‚ è¿™æ ·å¯ä»¥å‡å°‘æ•°æ®ç§»åŠ¨æ¬¡æ•°ï¼Œæé«˜æ•ˆç‡ã€‚ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 12345678910111213141516171819def shell_sort(arr): n = len(arr) gap = n // 2 # åˆå§‹æ­¥é•¿ while gap > 0: for i in range(gap, n): key = arr[i] j = i while j >= gap and arr[j - gap] > key: arr[j] = arr[j - gap] # åç§»å…ƒç´  j -= gap arr[j] = key # æ’å…¥å…ƒç´  gap //= 2 # ç¼©å°æ­¥é•¿ return arr# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [64, 25, 12, 22, 11]sorted_arr = shell_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [11, 12, 22, 25, 64] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) )ï¼ˆå–å†³äºæ­¥é•¿é€‰æ‹©ï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^2) )ï¼ˆæç«¯æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼‰ å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n^{1.3 - 2}) )ï¼ˆæ ¹æ®æ­¥é•¿åºåˆ—ä¸åŒï¼‰ ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(1) )ï¼ˆåŸåœ°æ’åºï¼‰ âœ… é€‚ç”¨äºä¸­ç­‰è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®ï¼Œæ¯”æ’å…¥æ’åºå’Œå†’æ³¡æ’åºæ›´å¿« ğŸš€ è®¡æ•°æ’åº ğŸ”¹ è®¡æ•°æ’åºï¼ˆCounting Sortï¼‰è®¡æ•°æ’åºåŸç†ï¼š é€‚ç”¨äºæ•´æ•°æ’åºï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯èŒƒå›´è¾ƒå°çš„éè´Ÿæ•´æ•°ã€‚ ç»Ÿè®¡æ¯ä¸ªå…ƒç´ å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨è®¡æ•°æ•°ç»„ï¼ˆæ¡¶ï¼‰è¿›è¡Œæ’åºã€‚ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦æ¥è¿‘ ( O(n) )ï¼Œä½†ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦è¾ƒé«˜ã€‚ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031def counting_sort(arr): if not arr: return arr max_val = max(arr) # æ‰¾åˆ°æ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼ min_val = min(arr) # æ‰¾åˆ°æ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„æœ€å°å€¼ range_val = max_val - min_val + 1 # è®¡ç®—å€¼åŸŸå¤§å° # åˆ›å»ºè®¡æ•°æ•°ç»„å¹¶åˆå§‹åŒ–ä¸º0 count = [0] * range_val output = [0] * len(arr) # ç»Ÿè®¡å…ƒç´ å‡ºç°æ¬¡æ•° for num in arr: count[num - min_val] += 1 # è®¡ç®—å‰ç¼€å’Œï¼Œç¡®å®šå…ƒç´ åœ¨è¾“å‡ºæ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„ä½ç½® for i in range(1, len(count)): count[i] += count[i - 1] # å¡«å……æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„ï¼ˆå€’åºéå†ç¡®ä¿ç¨³å®šæ€§ï¼‰ for num in reversed(arr): output[count[num - min_val] - 1] = num count[num - min_val] -= 1 return output# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [4, 2, 2, 8, 3, 3, 1]sorted_arr = counting_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 8] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n + k) )ï¼ˆk ä¸ºæ•°å€¼èŒƒå›´ï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n + k) ) å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n + k) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(k) ) + ( O(n) )ï¼ˆéœ€è¦é¢å¤–çš„è®¡æ•°æ•°ç»„ï¼‰ âœ… é€‚ç”¨äºæ•´æ•°æ’åºï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯æ•°æ®èŒƒå›´è¾ƒå°ã€é‡å¤ç‡è¾ƒé«˜çš„æƒ…å†µ ğŸš€ æ¡¶æ’åº æ¯ä¸ªæ¡¶å†…éƒ¨çš„æ’åºæ–¹å¼å¤šç§å¤šæ · åŸºæ•°æ’åº å½’å¹¶æ’åº ğŸ”¹ å½’å¹¶æ’åºï¼ˆMerge Sortï¼‰å½’å¹¶æ’åºåŸç†ï¼š åˆ†å‰²ï¼šå°†æ•°ç»„é€’å½’åœ°åˆ†æˆä¸¤åŠï¼Œç›´åˆ°æ¯éƒ¨åˆ†åªå‰©ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ã€‚ åˆå¹¶ï¼šåˆå¹¶ä¸¤ä¸ªæœ‰åºæ•°ç»„ï¼Œä¿æŒæ•´ä½“æœ‰åºã€‚ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ï¼š( O(n \log n) )ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºå¤§è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®æ’åºã€‚ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435def merge_sort(arr): if len(arr) <= 1: # é€’å½’ç»ˆæ­¢æ¡ä»¶ return arr # 1. åˆ†å‰²æ•°ç»„ mid = len(arr) // 2 left_half = merge_sort(arr[:mid]) # é€’å½’æ’åºå·¦åŠéƒ¨åˆ† right_half = merge_sort(arr[mid:]) # é€’å½’æ’åºå³åŠéƒ¨åˆ† # 2. åˆå¹¶ä¸¤ä¸ªæœ‰åºæ•°ç»„ return merge(left_half, right_half)def merge(left, right): sorted_list = [] i = j = 0 # å·¦å³æ•°ç»„çš„ç´¢å¼• # é€æ­¥åˆå¹¶ä¸¤ä¸ªæœ‰åºæ•°ç»„ while i < len(left) and j < len(right): if left[i] < right[j]: sorted_list.append(left[i]) i += 1 else: sorted_list.append(right[j]) j += 1 # å¤„ç†å‰©ä½™å…ƒç´  sorted_list.extend(left[i:]) sorted_list.extend(right[j:]) return sorted_list# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [12, 11, 13, 5, 6, 7]sorted_arr = merge_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [5, 6, 7, 11, 12, 13] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) ) æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) ) å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(n) )ï¼ˆéœ€è¦é¢å¤–çš„å­˜å‚¨ç©ºé—´ï¼‰ âœ… é€‚ç”¨äºå¤§è§„æ¨¡æ•°æ®æ’åºï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯ç¨³å®šæ’åºéœ€æ±‚åœºæ™¯ ğŸš€ å¿«é€Ÿæ’åº ğŸ”¹ å¿«é€Ÿæ’åºï¼ˆQuick Sortï¼‰åŸç†ï¼š é€‰æ‹©åŸºå‡†ï¼ˆpivotï¼‰ï¼šä¸€èˆ¬é€‰æ‹©æ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ä½œä¸ºåŸºå‡†ã€‚ åˆ†åŒºï¼ˆPartitionï¼‰ï¼š å°äºåŸºå‡†çš„æ”¾å·¦è¾¹ï¼Œ å¤§äºåŸºå‡†çš„æ”¾å³è¾¹ã€‚ é€’å½’å¤„ç†ï¼šåˆ†åˆ«å¯¹å·¦ã€å³å­æ•°ç»„é€’å½’æ‰§è¡Œå¿«é€Ÿæ’åºï¼Œç›´åˆ°æ•°ç»„æœ‰åºã€‚ ğŸ”¹ Python ä»£ç 123456789101112131415def quick_sort(arr): if len(arr) <= 1: # é€’å½’ç»ˆæ­¢æ¡ä»¶ return arr pivot = arr[len(arr) // 2] # é€‰æ‹©ä¸­é—´å…ƒç´ ä½œä¸ºåŸºå‡† left = [x for x in arr if x < pivot] # å°äºåŸºå‡†çš„å…ƒç´  middle = [x for x in arr if x == pivot] # ç­‰äºåŸºå‡†çš„å…ƒç´  right = [x for x in arr if x > pivot] # å¤§äºåŸºå‡†çš„å…ƒç´  return quick_sort(left) + middle + quick_sort(right) # é€’å½’æ’åºå¹¶åˆå¹¶# æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç arr = [10, 7, 8, 9, 1, 5]sorted_arr = quick_sort(arr)print("æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„:", sorted_arr) ğŸ”¹ è¿è¡Œç»“æœ1æ’åºåçš„æ•°ç»„: [1, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10] ğŸ”¹ æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ æœ€ä½³æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) ) æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µï¼ˆå·²æ’åºæ•°ç»„ï¼‰ï¼š( O(n^2) ) å¹³å‡æƒ…å†µï¼š( O(n \log n) ) ğŸ”¹ ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ ( O(\log n) )ï¼ˆé€’å½’æ ˆç©ºé—´ï¼‰ æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µå¯èƒ½è¾¾åˆ° ( O(n) )ï¼ˆå½“æ¯æ¬¡éƒ½é€‰åˆ°æœ€å°/æœ€å¤§å…ƒç´ ä½œä¸ºåŸºå‡†ï¼‰ âœ… å¿«é€Ÿæ’åºé€šå¸¸æ¯”å½’å¹¶æ’åºæ›´å¿«ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå®ƒä¸éœ€è¦é¢å¤–çš„åˆå¹¶æ­¥éª¤ï¼ ğŸš€ å †æ’åº æ€»ç»“

content: what is prompt EngineeringæŠ€å·§å°†æŒ‡ä»¤ä¸ä»£ç åˆ†å¼€1ä½¿ç”¨###å†…å®¹ï¼Œæˆ–"""å†…å®¹"""ï¼Œå°†æŒ‡ä»¤ä¸é¥æ“ä½œçš„å¯¹è±¡åˆ†å¼€ å°‘é‡æç¤ºåœ¨è®©AIæ‰§è¡ŒæŸé‡å¤æŒ‡ä»¤æ—¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æç¤ºå®ä¾‹ä¸€ä¸ªæ“ä½œ Prompt çš„å…¸å‹æ„æˆ è§’è‰²ï¼šç»™ AI å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªæœ€åŒ¹é…ä»»åŠ¡çš„è§’è‰²ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚ï¼šã€Œä½ æ˜¯ä¸€ä½è½¯ä»¶å·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆã€ã€Œä½ æ˜¯ä¸€ä½å°å­¦è€å¸ˆã€ æŒ‡ç¤ºï¼šå¯¹ä»»åŠ¡è¿›è¡Œæè¿° ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡ï¼šç»™å‡ºä¸ä»»åŠ¡ç›¸å…³çš„å…¶å®ƒèƒŒæ™¯ä¿¡æ¯ï¼ˆå°¤å…¶åœ¨å¤šè½®äº¤äº’ä¸­ï¼‰ ä¾‹å­ï¼šå¿…è¦æ—¶ç»™å‡ºä¸¾ä¾‹ï¼Œå­¦æœ¯ä¸­ç§°ä¸º one - shot learning, few - shot learning æˆ– in - context learningï¼›å®è·µè¯æ˜å…¶å¯¹è¾“å‡ºæ­£ç¡®æ€§æœ‰å¸®åŠ© è¾“å…¥ï¼šä»»åŠ¡çš„è¾“å…¥ä¿¡æ¯ï¼›åœ¨æç¤ºè¯ä¸­æ˜ç¡®çš„æ ‡è¯†å‡ºè¾“å…¥ è¾“å‡ºï¼šè¾“å‡ºçš„æ ¼å¼æè¿°ï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿åç»§æ¨¡å—è‡ªåŠ¨è§£ææ¨¡å‹çš„è¾“å‡ºç»“æœï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚ï¼ˆJSONã€XMLï¼‰ å¤§æ¨¡å‹å¯¹ prompt å¼€å¤´å’Œç»“å°¾çš„å†…å®¹æ›´æ•æ„Ÿ åŸåˆ™ä¸åŸç†å¤§æ¨¡å‹ï¼ˆLarge Modelï¼‰ é€šå¸¸æŒ‡çš„æ˜¯ å‚æ•°è§„æ¨¡åºå¤§ã€è®­ç»ƒæ•°æ®ä¸°å¯Œï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å…·å¤‡é€šç”¨èƒ½åŠ› çš„äººå·¥æ™ºèƒ½æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯åœ¨ è‡ªç„¶è¯­è¨€å¤„ç†ï¼ˆNLPï¼‰ã€è®¡ç®—æœºè§†è§‰ï¼ˆCVï¼‰å’Œå¤šæ¨¡æ€AI é¢†åŸŸã€‚ å¤§æ¨¡å‹ = è¶…å¤§è§„æ¨¡å‚æ•° + å¤§é‡è®­ç»ƒæ•°æ® + å¼ºæ³›åŒ–èƒ½åŠ›

title: arduinoç‚¹äº®36 RGB LEDs
content: 1234567891011121314151617181920#include <Adafruit_NeoPixel.h>#define LED_PIN 4 // LEDæ•°æ®è¾“å…¥è¿æ¥åˆ°Arduinoå¼•è„š4#define LED_COUNT 36 // LEDæ•°é‡ä¸º36Adafruit_NeoPixel strip = Adafruit_NeoPixel(LED_COUNT, LED_PIN, NEO_GRB + NEO_KHZ800);void setup() { strip.begin(); // åˆå§‹åŒ–LEDæ¡ strip.show(); // ç¡®ä¿æ‰€æœ‰LEDæœ€åˆæ˜¯å…³é—­çŠ¶æ€}void loop() { for (int i = 0; i < LED_COUNT; i++) { strip.setPixelColor(i, strip.Color(255, 0, 0)); // è®¾ç½®æ‰€æœ‰LEDä¸ºçº¢è‰² strip.show(); // æ˜¾ç¤ºé¢œè‰²å˜åŒ– delay(100); // ç­‰å¾…100æ¯«ç§’ }} å®éªŒç°è±¡ï¼š ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯æ·˜å®å•†å®¶ç»™çš„ä¾‹ç¨‹ * SparkFun WS2812 Breakout Board Example SparkFun Electronics date: July 25, 2013 license: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE Requires the Adafruit NeoPixel library. It's awesome, go get it. https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_NeoPixel This simple example code runs three sets of animations on a group of WS2812 breakout boards. The more boards you link up, the better these animations will look. For help linking WS2812 breakouts, checkout our hookup guide: https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/ws2812-breakout-hookup-guide Before uploading the code, make sure you adjust the two defines at the top of this sketch: PIN and LED_COUNT. Pin should be the Arduino pin you've got connected to the first pixel's DIN pin. By default it's set to Arduino pin 4. LED_COUNT should be the number of breakout boards you have linked up.*/#include <Adafruit_NeoPixel.h>#include "WS2812_Definitions.h"#define PIN 4#define LED_COUNT 36// Create an instance of the Adafruit_NeoPixel class called "leds".// That'll be what we refer to from here on...Adafruit_NeoPixel leds = Adafruit_NeoPixel(LED_COUNT, PIN, NEO_GRB + NEO_KHZ800);void setup(){ leds.begin(); // Call this to start up the LED strip. clearLEDs(); // This function, defined below, turns all LEDs off... leds.show(); // ...but the LEDs don't actually update until you call this.}void loop(){ // Ride the Rainbow Road for (int i=0; i<LED_COUNT*10; i++) { rainbow(i); delay(100); // Delay between rainbow slides } // Indigo cylon // Do a cylon (larson scanner) cycle 10 times for (int i=0; i<10; i++) { // cylon function: first param is color, second is time (in ms) between cycles cylon(INDIGO, 500); // Indigo cylon eye! } // A light shower of spring green rain // This will run the cascade from top->bottom 20 times for (int i=0; i<20; i++) { // First parameter is the color, second is direction, third is ms between falls cascade(MEDIUMSPRINGGREEN, TOP_DOWN, 100); }}// Implements a little larson "cylon" sanner.// This'll run one full cycle, down one way and back the othervoid cylon(unsigned long color, byte wait){ // weight determines how much lighter the outer "eye" colors are const byte weight = 4; // It'll be easier to decrement each of these colors individually // so we'll split them out of the 24-bit color value byte red = (color & 0xFF0000) >> 16; byte green = (color & 0x00FF00) >> 8; byte blue = (color & 0x0000FF); // Start at closest LED, and move to the outside for (int i=0; i<=LED_COUNT-1; i++) { clearLEDs(); leds.setPixelColor(i, red, green, blue); // Set the bright middle eye // Now set two eyes to each side to get progressively dimmer for (int j=1; j<3; j++) { if (i-j >= 0) leds.setPixelColor(i-j, red/(weight*j), green/(weight*j), blue/(weight*j)); if (i-j <= LED_COUNT) leds.setPixelColor(i+j, red/(weight*j), green/(weight*j), blue/(weight*j)); } leds.show(); // Turn the LEDs on delay(wait); // Delay for visibility } // Now we go back to where we came. Do the same thing. for (int i=LED_COUNT-2; i>=1; i--) { clearLEDs(); leds.setPixelColor(i, red, green, blue); for (int j=1; j<3; j++) { if (i-j >= 0) leds.setPixelColor(i-j, red/(weight*j), green/(weight*j), blue/(weight*j)); if (i-j <= LED_COUNT) leds.setPixelColor(i+j, red/(weight*j), green/(weight*j), blue/(weight*j)); } leds.show(); delay(wait); }}// Cascades a single direction. One time.void cascade(unsigned long color, byte direction, byte wait){ if (direction == TOP_DOWN) { for (int i=0; i<LED_COUNT; i++) { clearLEDs(); // Turn off all LEDs leds.setPixelColor(i, color); // Set just this one leds.show(); delay(wait); } } else { for (int i=LED_COUNT-1; i>=0; i--) { clearLEDs(); leds.setPixelColor(i, color); leds.show(); delay(wait); } }}// Sets all LEDs to off, but DOES NOT update the display;// call leds.show() to actually turn them off after this.void clearLEDs(){ for (int i=0; i<LED_COUNT; i++) { leds.setPixelColor(i, 0); }}// Prints a rainbow on the ENTIRE LED strip.// The rainbow begins at a specified position. // ROY G BIV!void rainbow(byte startPosition) { // Need to scale our rainbow. We want a variety of colors, even if there // are just 10 or so pixels. int rainbowScale = 192 / LED_COUNT; // Next we setup each pixel with the right color for (int i=0; i<LED_COUNT; i++) { // There are 192 total colors we can get out of the rainbowOrder function. // It'll return a color between red->orange->green->...->violet for 0-191. leds.setPixelColor(i, rainbowOrder((rainbowScale * (i + startPosition)) % 192)); } // Finally, actually turn the LEDs on: leds.show();}// Input a value 0 to 191 to get a color value.// The colors are a transition red->yellow->green->aqua->blue->fuchsia->red...// Adapted from Wheel function in the Adafruit_NeoPixel library example sketchuint32_t rainbowOrder(byte position) { // 6 total zones of color change: if (position < 31) // Red -> Yellow (Red = FF, blue = 0, green goes 00-FF) { return leds.Color(0xFF, position * 8, 0); } else if (position < 63) // Yellow -> Green (Green = FF, blue = 0, red goes FF->00) { position -= 31; return leds.Color(0xFF - position * 8, 0xFF, 0); } else if (position < 95) // Green->Aqua (Green = FF, red = 0, blue goes 00->FF) { position -= 63; return leds.Color(0, 0xFF, position * 8); } else if (position < 127) // Aqua->Blue (Blue = FF, red = 0, green goes FF->00) { position -= 95; return leds.Color(0, 0xFF - position * 8, 0xFF); } else if (position < 159) // Blue->Fuchsia (Blue = FF, green = 0, red goes 00->FF) { position -= 127; return leds.Color(position * 8, 0, 0xFF); } else //160 <position< 191 Fuchsia->Red (Red = FF, green = 0, blue goes FF->00) { position -= 159; return leds.Color(0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF - position * 8); }} å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ * Bunches of definitions for the WS2812 Breakout Board example code */ // These are for the cascade function#define TOP_DOWN 0#define DOWN_TOP 1/* A world of colors to set your LED to Standard HTML Color Codes sorted by Hex Value to see the colors in action, check out: http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_colorvalues.asp */ #define BLACK 0x000000#define NAVY 0x000080#define DARKBLUE 0x00008B#define MEDIUMBLUE 0x0000CD#define BLUE 0x0000FF#define DARKGREEN 0x006400#define GREEN 0x008000#define TEAL 0x008080#define DARKCYAN 0x008B8B#define DEEPSKYBLUE 0x00BFFF#define DARKTURQUOISE 0x00CED1#define MEDIUMSPRINGGREEN	0x00FA9A#define LIME 0x00FF00#define title: åŸºäºsimplefoc å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæ— åˆ·ç”µæœºæ“ä½œå¦ä¸€ä¸ªæ— åˆ·ç”µæœºè½¬åŠ¨
content: åŸºäºsimplefoc å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæ— åˆ·ç”µæœºæ“ä½œå¦ä¸€ä¸ªæ— åˆ·ç”µæœºè½¬åŠ¨ åŸºæœ¬æ¡†æ¶ ä¸»æœºä»£ç  1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071727374757677787980818283848586878889909192939495/** * Torque control example using voltage control loop. * * Most of the low-end BLDC driver boards doesn't have current measurement therefore SimpleFOC offers * you a way to control motor torque by setting the voltage to the motor instead hte current. * * This makes the BLDC motor effectively a DC motor, and you can use it in a same way. *///åŠ›çŸ©é—­ç¯#include <SimpleFOC.h>// magnetic sensor instance - SPI// MagneticSensorSPI sensor = MagneticSensorSPI(AS5147_SPI, 10);// magnetic sensor instance - I2CMagneticSensorI2C sensor = MagneticSensorI2C(AS5600_I2C);// magnetic sensor instance - analog output// MagneticSensorAnalog sensor = MagneticSensorAnalog(A1, 14, 1020);// BLDC motor & driver instanceBLDCMotor motor = BLDCMotor(7);BLDCDriver3PWM driver = BLDCDriver3PWM(9, 5, 6, 8);// Stepper motor & driver instance//StepperMotor motor = StepperMotor(50);//StepperDriver4PWM driver = StepperDriver4PWM(9, 5, 10, 6, 8);// voltage set point variablefloat target_voltage = 0;// instantiate the commanderCommander command = Commander(Serial);void doTarget(char* cmd) { command.scalar(&target_voltage, cmd); }void setup() { // use monitoring with serial Serial.begin(115200); // enable more verbose output for debugging // comment out if not needed SimpleFOCDebug::enable(&Serial); // initialise magnetic sensor hardware sensor.init(); // link the motor to the sensor motor.linkSensor(&sensor); // power supply voltage driver.voltage_power_supply = 12; driver.init(); motor.linkDriver(&driver); // aligning voltage motor.voltage_sensor_align = 5; // choose FOC modulation (optional) motor.foc_modulation = FOCModulationType::SpaceVectorPWM; // set motion control loop to be used motor.controller = MotionControlType::torque; // comment out if not needed motor.useMonitoring(Serial); // initialize motor motor.init(); // align sensor and start FOC motor.initFOC(); // add target command T command.add('T', doTarget, "target voltage"); Serial.println(F("Motor ready.")); Serial.println(F("Set the target voltage using serial terminal:")); _delay(1000);}void loop() { // main FOC algorithm function // the faster you run this function the better // Arduino UNO loop ~1kHz // Bluepill loop ~10kHz motor.loopFOC(); // Motion control function // velocity, position or voltage (defined in motor.controller) // this function can be run at much lower frequency than loopFOC() function // You can also use motor.move() and set the motor.target in the code motor.move(target_voltage); float angle_in_radians = sensor.getAngle(); Serial.println("T"+String(angle_in_radians)); // user communication command.run();} ä»æœºä»£ç  123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113/** * * Position/angle motion control example * Steps: * 1) Configure the motor and magnetic sensor * 2) Run the code * 3) Set the target angle (in radians) from serial terminal * */#include <SimpleFOC.h>// magnetic sensor instance - SPI// MagneticSensorSPI sensor = MagneticSensorSPI(AS5147_SPI, 10);//magnetic sensor instance - MagneticSensorI2CMagneticSensorI2C sensor = MagneticSensorI2C(AS5600_I2C);// magnetic sensor instance - analog output// MagneticSensorAnalog sensor = MagneticSensorAnalog(A1, 14, 1020);// BLDC motor & driver instanceBLDCMotor motor = BLDCMotor(11);BLDCDriver3PWM driver = BLDCDriver3PWM(9, 5, 6, 8);// Stepper motor & driver instance//StepperMotor motor = StepperMotor(50);//StepperDriver4PWM driver = StepperDriver4PWM(9, 5, 10, 6, 8);// angle set point variablefloat target_angle = 0;// instantiate the commanderCommander command = Commander(Serial);void doTarget(char* cmd) { command.scalar(&target_angle, cmd); }void setup() { // use monitoring with serial Serial.begin(115200); // enable more verbose output for debugging // comment out if not needed SimpleFOCDebug::enable(&Serial); // initialise magnetic sensor hardware sensor.init(); // link the motor to the sensor motor.linkSensor(&sensor); // driver config // power supply voltage [V] driver.voltage_power_supply = 12; driver.init(); // link the motor and the driver motor.linkDriver(&driver); // choose FOC modulation (optional) motor.foc_modulation = FOCModulationType::SpaceVectorPWM; // set motion control loop to be used motor.controller = MotionControlType::angle; // contoller configuration // default parameters in defaults.h // velocity PI controller parameters motor.PID_velocity.P = 0.15f; motor.PID_velocity.I = 0; motor.PID_velocity.D = 0; // maximal voltage to be set to the motor motor.voltage_limit = 6; // velocity low pass filtering time constant // the lower the less filtered motor.LPF_velocity.Tf = 0.03f; // angle P controller motor.P_angle.P = 20; // maximal velocity of the position control motor.velocity_limit = 20; // comment out if not needed motor.useMonitoring(Serial); // initialize motor motor.init(); // align sensor and start FOC motor.initFOC(); // add target command T command.add('T', doTarget, "target angle"); Serial.println(F("Motor ready.")); Serial.println(F("Set the target angle using serial terminal:")); _delay(1000);}void loop() { // main FOC algorithm function // the faster you run this function the better // Arduino UNO loop ~1kHz // Bluepill loop ~10kHz motor.loopFOC(); // Motion control function // velocity, position or voltage (defined in motor.controller) // this function can be run at much lower frequency than loopFOC() function // You can also use motor.move() and set the motor.target in the code motor.move(target_angle); float angle_in_radians = sensor.getAngle(); Serial.println(angle_in_radians); // function intended to be used with serial plotter to monitor motor variables // significantly slowing the execution down!!!! // motor.monitor(); i < count; i++) { int a = analogRead(A0); int b = analogRead(A1); sum += (a - b); // ç´¯åŠ å·®å€¼ delay(5); // æ¯æ¬¡è¯»å–ä¹‹é—´çš„å»¶æ—¶ï¼Œé˜²æ­¢æ•°æ®è¿‡äºå¯†é›† } int average = sum / count; // è®¡ç®—å¹³å‡å€¼ if (average < 90) { // å¦‚æœå¹³å‡å€¼å°äº90ï¼Œæ‰“å°"none" Serial.println("none"); } else if (average > 160) { // å¦‚æœå¹³å‡å€¼å¤§äº160ï¼Œæ‰“å°"out" Serial.println("out"); } else { // å½“å¹³å‡å€¼åœ¨90åˆ°160ä¹‹é—´ï¼Œçº¿æ€§æ’å€¼è®¡ç®—æ¯«ç±³å€¼ float mmValue = 0; if (average >= mi15 && average <= mi20) { // å¦‚æœå¹³å‡å€¼å°äºæˆ–ç­‰äº mi15ï¼Œåˆ™æŒ‰1.5mmå¤„ç† mmValue = 1.5 + (float(average - mi15) / (mi20 - mi15)) * (2.0 - 1.5); } Serial.print("æ¯«ç±³å€¼: "); Serial.println(mmValue); // æ‰“å°æ¯«ç±³å€¼ }} ç›®å‰å­˜åœ¨é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå˜åŒ–å¹…åº¦å°ï¼Œåˆ†è¾¨ç‡ä½ éœå°”æ£€æµ‹ä¿®æ­£å¢åŠ å·®åˆ†æ”¾å¤§ï¼Œæ”¾å¤§4.7å€ï¼ŒOUTå¼•è„šè¯»å– æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç å¦‚ä¸‹ 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869#define READ_COUNT 5 // è¿ç»­è¯»å–æ¬¡æ•°// æ¥çº¿ï¼šA0æ¥OUT,A2æ¥IN-,A3æ¥IN+// å®šä¹‰æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼å¯¹åº”çš„æ¯«ç±³æ•°const float VALUE_0_0MM = 222.0; // 0.0mm å¯¹åº”çš„æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼const float VALUE_1_5MM = 382.0; // 1.5mm å¯¹åº”çš„æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼const float VALUE_2_0MM = 440.0; // 2.0mm å¯¹åº”çš„æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼void setup() { Serial.begin(9600); // åˆå§‹åŒ–ä¸²å£é€šè®¯}void loop() { // è¯»å–æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼ float analogValueA0 = readAverage(A0); float mmValueA0 = calculateMM(analogValueA0); float analogValueA1 = readAverage(A2); float mmValueA1 = calculateMM(analogValueA1); float analogValueA2 = readAverage(A3); float mmValueA2 = calculateMM(analogValueA2); // æ‰“å°ç»“æœ Serial.print("A0 - Analog: "); Serial.print(analogValueA0); Serial.print(" mm: "); Serial.println(mmValueA0); Serial.print("A2 - Analog: "); Serial.print(analogValueA1); Serial.print(" mm: "); Serial.println(mmValueA1); Serial.print("A3 - Analog: "); Serial.print(analogValueA2); Serial.print(" mm: "); Serial.println(mmValueA2); delay(100); // å»¶è¿Ÿ100æ¯«ç§’}// è¯»å–æŒ‡å®šæ¨¡æ‹Ÿå¼•è„šçš„å¹³å‡å€¼float readAverage(int pin) { long sum = 0; // ç”¨äºç´¯åŠ è¯»å–å€¼ for (int i = 0; i < READ_COUNT; i++) { sum += analogRead(pin); delay(10); // è¯»å–é—´éš”ï¼Œé¿å…è¯»å–è¿‡å¿« } return sum / (float)READ_COUNT; // è¿”å›å¹³å‡å€¼}// æ ¹æ®æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼è®¡ç®—æ¯«ç±³æ•°ï¼ˆçº¿æ€§å˜åŒ–å…¬å¼ï¼‰float calculateMM(float analogValue) { // æ£€æŸ¥æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå€¼èŒƒå›´ï¼Œç¡®ä¿çº¿æ€§æ’å€¼æ­£å¸¸å·¥ä½œ if (analogValue <= VALUE_0_0MM) return 0.0; // å°äºç­‰äº 0.0mm if (analogValue >= VALUE_2_0MM) return 2.0; // å¤§äºç­‰äº 2.0mm // ä½¿ç”¨åˆ†æ®µçº¿æ€§æ’å€¼è®¡ç®— if (analogValue <= VALUE_1_5MM) { // èŒƒå›´ [0.0mm, 1.5mm] return (analogValue - VALUE_0_0MM) * (1.5 - 0.0) / (VALUE_1_5MM - VALUE_0_0MM); } else { // èŒƒå›´ [1.5mm, 2.0mm] return 1.5 + (analogValue - VALUE_1_5MM) * (2.0 - 1.5) / (VALUE_2_0MM - VALUE_1_5MM); }} çº¿æ€§CCDæ£€æµ‹CCDçš„åŸºæœ¬åŸç†

} } else{ analogWrite(motor1,motor1_speed); analogWrite(motor2,motor2_speed); }}int pid(){ P = err; I += err; D = err - last_err; output = kp*P + ki*I + kd*D; last_err = err; return output;}void sensor(){ int a_1 = digitalRead(infrared[0]); int a_2 = digitalRead(infrared[1]); int a_3 = digitalRead(infrared[2]); int a_4 = digitalRead(infrared[3]); int a_5 = digitalRead(infrared[4]); int a_6 = digitalRead(infrared[5]); int a_7 = digitalRead(infrared[6]); if(a_1==black && a_2==white && a_3==white && a_4==white && a_5==white && a_6==white && a_7==white){ err = -4; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==black && a_3==white && a_4==white && a_5==white && a_6==white && a_7==white){ err = -2; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==white && a_3==black && a_4==white && a_5==white && a_6==white && a_7==white){ err = -1; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==white && a_3==white && a_4==black && a_5==white && a_6==white && a_7==white){ err = 0; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==white && a_3==white && a_4==white && a_5==black && a_6==white && a_7==white){ err = 1; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==white && a_3==white && a_4==white && a_5==white && a_6==black && a_7==white){ err = 2; } else if(a_1==white && a_2==white && a_3==white && a_4==white && a_5==white && a_6==white && a_7==black){ err = 4; } Serial.println(err); //æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç }

myservo.attach(servoPin); // è¯¥èˆµæœºç”±arduinoç¬¬9è„šæ§åˆ¶ pinMode(motorPin, OUTPUT); // å°†ç”µæœºå¼•è„šè®¾ä¸ºè¾“å‡ºæ¨¡å¼ myservo.write(pos_mid); // èˆµæœºå¤ä½ analogWrite(motorPin,0); // ç”µæœºåˆå§‹è½¬åŠ¨ delay(1000);} void loop() { if (Serial.available() >= 2) { int servoValue = Serial.read(); int motorValue = Serial.read(); // æ§åˆ¶èˆµæœº myservo.write(servoValue); if (servoValue <40) servoValue=40; else if(servoValue > 140) servoValue=140; Serial.print("servo: "); Serial.println(servoValue); // æ§åˆ¶ç”µæœº if (motorValue <0) motorValue=0; else if(motorValue > 255) motorValue=255; analogWrite(motorPin, motorValue); Serial.print("motor: "); Serial.println(motorValue); } } ä¸Šä½æœºä»£ç æ–‡ä»¶å key_control.py 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142# Author: æ— å¿§# Date: 2023-12-02# Description: è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªé”®ç›˜æ§åˆ¶çš„ç®€å•ä»£ç # è¯·è°ƒèŠ‚é”®ç›˜çŠ¶æ€ä¸ºè‹±è¯­å°å†™çŠ¶æ€# -------------------- import keyboardimport time# è¦ä¸‹åŒ…keyboardfrom send_M_S import * speed = 0speed_max = 60 # é€Ÿåº¦çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼turn = 92 # èˆµæœºä¸­å€¼turn_l = 60 # èˆµæœºæ‰“è§’æœ€å·¦turn_r = 120 # èˆµæœºæ‰“è§’æœ€å³ if __name__ == "__main__": ser = init_send() while True: try: if keyboard.is_pressed('w'): speed += 5 if speed >= speed_max: speed = speed_max elif keyboard.is_pressed('a'): turn -= 8 if turn <= turn_l: turn = turn_l elif keyboard.is_pressed('d'): turn += 8 if turn >= turn_r: turn = turn_r elif keyboard.is_pressed('s'): speed -= 5 if speed <= 0: speed = 0 time.sleep(0.1) # ç³»ç»Ÿå“åº”é€Ÿåº¦ send_values(ser, turn, speed) except KeyboardInterrupt: break ä¸Šä½æœºä¸²å£ä»£ç æ–‡ä»¶åsend_M_S 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233# Author:# Date: 2023-12-02# Description: This script does XYZ.import serialimport timeimport sys # è®¾ç½®ä¸²å£å‚æ•°def init_send(): ser = serial.Serial('COM4', 115200, timeout=1) return ser def send_values(ser, servo_value, motor_value): # å‘ä¸²å£å‘é€èˆµæœºå€¼å’Œç”µæœºå€¼ time.sleep(0.1) ser.write(bytes([servo_value, motor_value])) while ser.in_waiting: arduino_feedback = ser.readline().decode() print("Arduino:", arduino_feedback) if __name__ == '__main__': # åˆå§‹åŒ–ä¸²å£ ser = init_send() try: while True: for i in range(60, 120, 1): send_values(ser, i, 50) for i in range(120, 60, -1): send_values(ser, i, 50) except KeyboardInterrupt: # åœ¨ç”¨æˆ·æŒ‰ä¸‹ Ctrl+C æ—¶ï¼Œå…³é—­ä¸²å£å¹¶é€€å‡ºç¨‹åº ser.close() sys.exit()
